OwnerUser.AboutMe: I've been working as a teacher of English and German for more than 10 years already. Linguistics is my life-long passion, I can speak and read no less than 12 languages well, I am studying Malay and Manju at the moment. My native languages are Ukrainian and Russian.

Body: The essential difference is that a long vowel has one peak, and a double vowel has two peaks, usually the peaks are of pitch or loudness, or phonation, if it is used in a language. I know only of the languages in which double vowels form two different syllables.
